discussion.content:
Correct answer: D
Layer 2 forwarding of multicast traffic with vPC is based on a modified IGMP snooping behavior that consists mostly of synchronizing the IGMP entries between vPC primary and secondary devices.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/switches/nexus-5000-series-switches/design_guide_c07-625857.html

questions.question_text: Layer 2 forwarding of multicast traffic with vPC is based on which modified protocol?
Which two technologies can be used to minimize routing on the DC Core layer from being compromised? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Correct answer: BC
Route summarization does not provide routing from being compromised, but route peer authentication does.

choices.D: the configured security access control list policies

questions.question_text:
You are sizing the aggregation layer for a data center. Which two factors influence the size of the TCAM table space on the aggregation data center switches?
(Choose two.)
You plan to implement a fully integrated firewall design by using a Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series VSS. Which description of the implementation is true?

choices.D: Firewall services run at the aggregation layer.
choices.B: A standalone firewall appliance is required.
choices.C: A routing protocol must be configured between the firewall and the Cisco Catalyst 6500 VSS.
choices.A: The firewall can be managed independently from the Cisco Catalyst 6500 VSS.

discussion.content:
mistake answer: D 
The Cisco Catalyst 6500 platform offers the option of integrating service modules directly into card slots within the chassis, thereby conserving valuable rack space, power, and cabling in the data center network. One common design model is to integrate these modules directly into the aggregation-layer switches within the hierarchical network design, as shown in Figure 5. This approach is commonly taken when there are available slots within existing aggregation-layer switches, or chassis slot capacity is planned and allocated to the service modules in the initial design. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/Data_Center/vssdc_integrate.html
"fully integrated firewall" mean card in 6500, so I think answer: A

Class 3â€”Datagram service. The device drivers determine if data is not received and needs to be retransmitted.

Connectionless

Unacknowledged delivery
,D is correct

Class 3 Fibre Channel service is a connectionless service using frame switching, like Class 2. However unlike Class 2, Class 3 is designed around a datagram model and Fibre Channel doesn't check for missing or corrupted frames. Flow control and data integrity are handled by a higher-level protocol such as TCP (Transmission Control Protocol). However there is link-level flow control between the fabric and each connected device.

questions.question_text: Which option is a characteristic of a Class 3 F Fibre Channel service?
